description: Template coordinate configuration for Social Media Prep Tool

canvas_size.note: All outputs are 1080x1350 pixels (Instagram portrait format)

how_to_measure: 1. Open template PNG file in image editor (Photoshop, GIMP, etc.)
2. Use rectangular selection tool to select the RED area
3. Note the coordinates shown in the info panel
4. Format: x (left edge), y (top edge), width, height

coordinate_format.x: Distance from left edge in pixels
coordinate_format.y: Distance from top edge in pixels
coordinate_format.width: Width of content area in pixels
coordinate_format.height: Height of content area in pixels

1-1-small.name: Square Small (1:1)
1-1-small.description: Small centered square for portrait-style content
1-1-small.notes: Adjust x/y to shift position, adjust width/height to change size (keep equal for square)

1-1-large.name: Square Large (1:1)
1-1-large.description: Large centered square for bold content
1-1-large.notes: Larger square, closer to edges. Keep width=height for perfect square.

16-9.name: Landscape (16:9)
16-9.notes: For 16:9 aspect ratio, keep width:height ratio = 16:9 (1.778)

2x-16-9.name: Dual Landscape (2x 16:9)
2x-16-9.description: Two stacked landscape areas for comparison/split content
2x-16-9.notes: Both zones should have same dimensions. Adjust y values to control spacing.

quick_adjustments.shift_all_left: Decrease all 'x' values by same amount
quick_adjustments.shift_all_right: Increase all 'x' values by same amount
quick_adjustments.shift_all_up: Decrease all 'y' values by same amount
quick_adjustments.shift_all_down: Increase all 'y' values by same amount
quick_adjustments.make_larger: Increase width/height, decrease x/y by half the increase
quick_adjustments.make_smaller: Decrease width/height, increase x/y by half the decrease
quick_adjustments.example: To shift 16-9 template 10px right and 5px down: x=36→46, y=357→362

testing_tips.1: Process a test image with known content position
testing_tips.2: Check if red borders are visible in output
testing_tips.3: If red shows on left: increase x value
testing_tips.4: If red shows on right: decrease x or increase width
testing_tips.5: If red shows on top: increase y value
testing_tips.6: If red shows on bottom: decrease y or increase height
testing_tips.7: Make small adjustments (5-10 pixels at a time)
testing_tips.8: Save this file and restart the application to apply changes
